awd_titl_txt: The Re-Os System in Mantle-Derived Rocks
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this proposal is to apply the Re/Os system to                  problems in mantle evolution and the nature of mantle magma sources             using the decay of 187Re to 187Os as the natural tracer.  This                  study will focus on 1) comparing the 187Os/186Os ratios of                      mid-ocean ridge basalts with those of ocean island basalts; 2) the              coupled use of 187Os/186Os and 3He/4He variations in basalts                    elucidating magma sources; 3) a systematic study of carefully                   documented samples of the Mesozoic Appalachian tholeiite province               of eastern North AMerica will determine the controls on Re and Os               abundances during generation and evolution of mantle-derived magmas             on long-term Re/Os systematics of lithosphere mantle.  The samples              will be analyzed for 187Os/186Os by negative ion thermal ionization             mass spectrometry (NTIMS).  Re concentrations will continue to be               determined by SIMS.  This work should provide a broader                         understanding of the origin of mantle magmas.
